description: A celebration of women in senior leadership roles at Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole (BCP) Council and local business and community leaders will take place on International Women's Day (IWD).

Footballers in Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole (BCP) are enjoying perfect playing facilities at Rossmore Leisure Centre, thanks to a £726,000 grant from the Premier League, The FA and Government’s Football Foundation.
The next phase of pedestrian, cycle and bus service improvements on Magna Road in Poole will get underway on Monday 11 March.
Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole (BCP) Council has provided an update to residents and stakeholders around events planned for Poole Quay in 2024 and into the New Year 2025.
The majority (96%) of children due to start secondary school in Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole (BCP) this September have been offered a place at one of their preferred schools.
Work to inspect, upgrade and repair Sopley Bridge in Christchurch is set to be carried out by Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole (BCP) Council next week.

Residents, businesses and visitors are being asked for their views on how bus services can be improved across Bournemouth town centre to enhance their reliability, encourage greater use and help reduce congestion.

A statutory direction – where the government instructs organisations to make improvements – has been published today, regarding Special Educational Needs and Disability (SEND) services in Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole, reflecting those findings and recognising the improved measures that have already been put in place.
Voters in the Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole area are being reminded that they need to show an accepted form of photographic identification for forthcoming elections
The Ukrainian flag will be raised at Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole (BCP) Council’s Civic Centre to mark the second anniversary of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine this Saturday 24 February.
